meanings.definition: To have grown up or matured.
meanings.sent1: She has upgrown into a responsible young adult.
meanings.sent2: Children upgrown into adults over time.
meanings.sent3: The little seedling upgrown into a towering tree overnight!
meanings.sent4: Her confidence upgrown like a mighty oak tree, strong and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The town upgrown rapidly, transforming from a small village to a bustling city.

meanings.sent1: The upgrown children were now leading the expedition.
meanings.sent2: The upgrown plants towered over the garden.
meanings.sent3: The upgrown cake was too big for the tiny plate.
meanings.sent4: His upgrown beard was a symbol of his journey through life.
meanings.sent5: The upgrown building cast a long shadow over the street.
